definition: seizing property that belongs to someone else and holding it until profits pay the demand for which it was seized
details:
noun
- seizing property that belongs to someone else and holding it until profits pay the demand for which it was seized
= synonyms: requisition
- the act of segregating or sequestering
= example: the act of segregating or sequestering
= synonyms: segregation
- a writ that authorizes the seizure of property
- the action of forming a chelate or other stable compound with an ion or atom or molecule so that it is no longer available for reactions
